title: #293 - Preparing for Architecture School
itunes:title: #293 - Preparing for Architecture School
description:
This week David and Marina discuss how to prepare for undergraduate architecture school. The two cover learning different skills and tools such as software programs, sculpture, drawing, and painting; learning about construction; common challenges students face; architectural education in general; dealing with negativity in the profession of architecture; and more. Enjoy!

  • (03:44) Learning computer programs such as CAD, Rhino, SketchUp, or Revit.
  • (27:50) Sculpture, drawing, and painting classes
  • (34:01) Architecture school is not only about creating “hirable” graduates
  • (43:22) Learning about construction
  • (51:09) The mindset of a designer: Embracing failure and the process of redesigning.
  • (59:55) Buildings are more complicated today than ever before. Should architecture education evolve?
  • (01:05:00) Learning about financial management
  • (01:08:10) Dealing with negativity: Should architecture students be optimistic about their future careers in architecture?

This episode is supported by Brizo • Monograph • Miele • Graphisoft
